intro: Centradenia ovata, commonly known as the oval leaf centradenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, ovate-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Centradenia ovata is often found in moist, shaded areas within forests or along riverbanks.
